discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
the IP address expired. The DHCP server was never asked to lease a new IP address because the computer is running 24/7. This is the only reasonable reason.
how would the answer be out of office if you did not turn it on. and even if you did turn it on by accident you would still get the email but it would just auto reply. it's definitely internet issue

You receive emails when OOO set. Its a function to let the senders know your are OOO not to stop receiving emails.
SMTP can be disregarded as the issue is about receiving emails not to send.
Internet connectivity issue affects others too. 
As the PC has been on, OS update mustve been run and failed. I guess this is the only reasonable choice here.

A. There is an OS update failure.
B. Out-of-office is turned on.
C. There is an Internet connectivity issue.
D. SMTP services are not running.

So it could be due to him being somewhere he normally isn't, poorly worded question again though.

discussion.content: Guys, "did not receive emails over the weekend like he usually does", means the past weekend he is ok, so should not be OOO?

I think it's B. Out-of-Office is an auto-response feature in Microsoft 365 main. 
https://www.wikihow.com/Turn-On-or-Off-the-Out-of-Office-Assistant-in-Microsoft-Outlook
The wording counts here -- an Internet connectivity issue is MORE likely to happen than SMTP services being turned off!

questions.question_text: Joe, a user, did not receive emails over the weekend like he usually does. Productivity software is functioning properly. Joe never powers off his computer and typically leaves all applications open. No other users are reporting email issues. Which of the following is MOST likely the cause of the issue?

choices.C: There is an Internet connectivity issue.
choices.A: There is an OS update failure.

questions.question_text: A technician needs to allow RDP access for a user. Port forwarding is already set up for port 3389. The technician will have to change the listening port for the new access. Which of the following OS tools should the technician use on the PC to change the listening port for RDP?

discussion.content:
You cannot change listening port in Services. The question is poorly stated as well. I assume they mean make sure the PC is listening on that port. You change the port in the registry. 

You would open the port by using the local firewall tool whether it is windows defender or some other firewall.

Selected Answer: B
You can open the Remote Desktop Connection client by going to Run –> mstsc. Simply put, the default port for using the Remote Desktop Protocol is 3389. This port should be open through Windows Firewall to make it RDP accessible within the local area network.

Selected Answer: B
It should be MSTSC - You can open the Remote Desktop Connection client by going to Run –> mstsc. Simply put, the default port for using the Remote Desktop Protocol is 3389. This port should be open through Windows Firewall to make it RDP accessible within the local area network.
Mstsc->in rdp window select ip to connect to->add a port

The reference article clearly states that the port is changed by editing the registry, not services. the RDP service is restarted once the change is made, but that's it. All other articles on the subject confirm this. A is the best answer.
(EL TECNICO NECESITA PERMITIR) si necesita permitir entonces es cortafuegos la respuesta. Esta mal redactada y es confusa.

Checked the ref. page below and theres 2 steps to changed the port for RDP.
1.you create a new port rule on local firewall.
2.set the newly opened port for RDP by registry editor.
https://upcloud.com/community/tutorials/resolve-problems-windows-remote-desktop/

Firewall and regedit both can be the answer. I dont understand why D.Services was chosen as the answer by the site. They should know A.Local Firewall is the answer after reading this or am I missing something??
The answer is D lol
"OS tools"

discussion.content:
Why isn't it B? https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/administration/windows-commands/mstsc

"/V:<server>[:<port>] - Specifies the remote computer and, optionally, the port number to which you want to connect."

found in reference page of the answer:
In the Services (Local) list, scroll down to find Remote Desktop Service, and restart it. A confirmation popup asks to restart other related services as well, click Yes to continue.

You will get disconnected if you were using RDP to make these changes. Afterwards just reconnect to your new port by defining it in the Computer field on RDP connection.
Microsoft pdf printer was introduced with Windows 10. I assume this is what is being referred to in the question.

It's win10 from MS answer
https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/forum/all/microsoft-print-to-pdf-unavailable-in-windows/39db0fa8-f72c-4ab4-be12-03fbd4631545

Selected Answer: D
Print to PDF One of the most popular virtual printing options is the ability to print to PDF, a feature every operating system supports out of the box these days. Windows didn’t join the party until Windows 10, however, so be aware that you’ll need to install a virtual PDF printer on older versions of Windows. You can get these through official Adobe software, but there are also some third-party options. 
from all-on-ome by mike meyers

Selected Answer: D
Windows 10

Who in the H$%%$# puts the ref under the answer. This site is a waist of money. 

You've posted your question in the Windows 7 section of these forums, and from your screenshots, it does appear that you have Windows 7.

Microsoft Print to PDF is only available for Windows 10.

You can "Save as PDF" from Microsoft Office applications or your can "print to PDF" using a number of third-party utilities, some of which are free.

questions.question_text: Which of the following Microsoft operating systems comes with a PDF printer as part of the OS functionality?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
If you use share permissions and NTFS permissions together, the most restrictive permission will take precedence over the other. For example, if NTFS share permissions are set to Full Control, but share permissions are set to “Read,” the user will only be able to read the file or look at the items in the folder

Selected Answer: A
NTFS will overide the share permissions reducing the options to Read.

questions.question_text: A folder has the share permissions of everyone `" change, while the folder's NTFS permissions are set to everyone `" read. Which of the following would be the MOST effective permissions for someone who is accessing the folder via the share?

choices.B: Instruct the user to change the device's password.
choices.A: Run a malware scan on the device.
choices.C: Disable access to the user's contacts.

discussion.content:
How will this help? Changing the password only stops someone who has been accessing the phone physically to no longer be able to do so. 
A. It is possible it is malware causing this
B. As I already said, useless imo
C. If it is the app sending the emails (question said it is) then this is the best answer imo
D. It is emails, not text messages so can't be this

It could be A or C, but imo it is C

comments.content: I agree. Also since it is a social media app (It should be considered "Trusted" in a sense) making malware unlikely the cause of the symptom. So, C.

discussion.content: B is the right answer, It sounds like the user has not given the app enough permissions to access contacts or send out emails. The owner of the phone has the app only on her phone. Which means another person might know her password and be using her app to send unsolicited messages on her behalf when she leaves her phone on it's own. So if she changes the password the other person cannot access the app.

Selected Answer: C

C. Disable access to which contacts? Email contacts, phone contacts? The answer isn't clear whatsoever.
D. Irrelevant. It's email messages that are being sent, not text.
